intro: Amphithalea flava, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Amphithalea flava is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
